text: was an old province in the area that is today Fukushima Prefecture and Miyagi Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Iwaki" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 408. The history of the province started in 718 and ended between 722 and 724. ==History== Iwaki Province was created during the reign of Empress Genshō.Meyners d'Estrey, Guillaume Henry Jean (1884). Annales de l'Extrême Orient et de l'Afrique, Vol. 6, p. 172; excerpt, Genshō crée sept provinces : Idzumi, Noto, Atoa, Iwaki, Iwase, Suwa et Sado en empiétant sur celles de Kawachi, Echizen, Etchū, Kazusa, Mutsu and Shinano ==Related pages== * Iwaki Province (1868) * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan ==References== ==Other websites == * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Former provinces of Japan Category:Fukushima Prefecture Category:Miyagi Prefecture Category:710s establishments in Japan Category:720s disestablishments in Japan
title: Iwaki Province (718)
